b4d3ee14-3a39-4605-a197-df90163efaa6.description: Military leadership training for prospective battalion commanders and their staff. The 5 week course includes basic processes in decision-making and their products, staff work and tactics. In addition, the technical specialists are enabled to make their specific contributions and concepts. Finally, what has been learned is applied in a battalion staff, linked together and tested in a simulation as part of "monitoring the situation".
b4d3ee14-3a39-4605-a197-df90163efaa6.name: Commanders and Staff Members

badge_template_activities.title: The decision-making process is applied in a structured and networked manner under time pressure.
The leadership and staff technique is applied.
The technical and staff work is applied and added value is created for the decision-makers.
Communication is understandable, appropriate and addressee-oriented.
The knowledge of specialists is called upon.
Systems and applications are used to support.
Meaningful and economical use of resources.
Current security policy issues are known.

43ff53e7-482d-40a1-90d1-83d44d4e4911.description: Practical problem solving and decision making methodology (40 h). During military cadre training, officers learn to quickly develop useful and viable solutions. This knowledge is made available to civilians in the first phase of this training. Using civil examples, you will learn how to apply the management skills in a practical manner. The Management Basic Course focuses on the methodological competence of management technique.
43ff53e7-482d-40a1-90d1-83d44d4e4911.name: Management Basic

badge_template_activities.title: Know criteria to approach difficult tasks holistically
Acquire knowledge to design leadership processes in a goal-oriented manner
To train thinking in variants in order to work out reasonable solutions
Acquire basic knowledge to cope with crisis situations
Learn and apply efficient work and presentation techniques
Questioning management methods and developing them further for oneself

d7603fa6-5f1f-44c8-8b22-cc03d34390aa.description: Customised education and training in crisis situations. Executives and crisis teams can learn and train the modern military decision-making methodology for dealing with crisis situations. If desired, the training facilities and the individual training objectives are developed together with the customer and implemented in a customised manner.
d7603fa6-5f1f-44c8-8b22-cc03d34390aa.name: Workshop Problemsolving (Typ A)

badge_template_activities.title: Understand the differences and commonalities as well as possibilities and limitations of military and civilian decision-making processes.
Know and be able to apply approaches for the structured solution of difficult tasks.
Be able to design decision-making processes in a goal-oriented manner.
Be able to apply variant thinking in the solution-finding process.
Be able to organise cooperation in teams and staffs.

1c30d6e7-ffe4-437b-9758-556ac77aa5cc.description: The 48h-course (28h of training) focuses on learning the military way of working to lead and manage crises (rapport management, situation tracking), how to work effectively in a staff (leadership and work techniques), methods for structured decision-making and models for "thinking in variants". The process of crisis management, the so-called "5+2" model, serves as a basis. FurthermoreThe basics of presentation and visualization techniques are developed and applied under professional guidance.
1c30d6e7-ffe4-437b-9758-556ac77aa5cc.name: Crisis Management Seminar

badge_template_activities.title: The participants completed the 3-days course in "Crisis Management Seminar" at MIKA Command.
The participants learned to apply the Swiss Armes Forces´ "5+2" problem solution technique.
The participants achieved to lead a crisis management team applying the Swiss Armes Forces´ staff management techniques in an intense crisis management exercise

The participants learned to produce timely, well-informed decisions under pressure and fatigue. Furthermore they achieved to provide high-quality and timely contributions to the evaluation/decision process.
The participants achieved to deliver essential and concise information in a factual, convincing manner.

The participants learned to develop a media statement and effectively communicate a core message in a further interview. Furthermore they experienced a feedback from media experts on their behaviour in front of journalists and/or cameras.

fdfb2e89-82ef-47a1-af9e-a66af44150e1.description: Leadership activities in crisis situations and under time pressure (40 h). A crisis situation is characterized by a strong pressure to make decisions whereby time is extremely limited. In the Intermediate course, you will learn and train methods for managing crisis situations under difficult conditions. The Management Basic course focuses on staff technique and associated knowledge while the Management Intermediate course addresses leadership behavior.
fdfb2e89-82ef-47a1-af9e-a66af44150e1.name: Management Intermediate

badge_template_activities.title: Deepen insights from the TRANSFER Basic course
Understand key elements of successful leadership
Reflect on leadership characteristics in oneself and others
Practically apply leadership skills in crisis situations under time pressure
Practicing the principles of communication in everyday leadership
Actively shaping cooperation in teams and staffs
Solve even complex tasks holistically, on time and with promising quality

f8daa86c-987d-44a9-8224-991ed8ca11f0.description: Military leadership training for prospective company commanders. The 4 week course includes basic processes in decision-making needed for planning and leading operations, tactical and leadership techniques and management techniques for company administration. The knowledge of current security policy topics and the understanding of the military's role and missions is deepened at an academic level. What has been learned is applied, linked together and tested in a simulation.
f8daa86c-987d-44a9-8224-991ed8ca11f0.name: Company Level Leadership Course

badge_template_activities.title: The decision-making process is applied in a structured manner under time pressure
The leadership technique is applied
Communication is understandable, appropriate and addressee-oriented
Systems and applications are used to support
Meaningfull and economical use of resources
Current security policy issues are known

3f4ea929-fb80-44e0-b9d7-fe2d9d25c998.description: Decision-makers train their role in crisis situations (40 h). In order to survive in a crisis situation, it makes sense to follow a simple and clear process. A decision-maker must be able to critically question and analyze courses of action presented to him by the staff. The decision maker's action guidelines direct the activities of the staff with the aim of making appropriate decisions in good time.
3f4ea929-fb80-44e0-b9d7-fe2d9d25c998.name: Management Advanced

badge_template_activities.title: Manage a crisis through consistent application of the military command and control process as part of staff work
Enabling the decision maker to become aware of the role and responsibility as a crisis manager
Learning to make appropriate decisions under time pressure
Exploiting the potential of a staff to achieve better overall results
Derive lessons and experiences for one's own area of activity
And furthermore: To be able to make at least useful decisions at any time, even under difficult conditions (physical and psychological stress)

b25d9e11-c9ba-4d58-b497-db4f0321c9cd.description: The earners of this badge have participated in the Transfer Management program for a minimum period of two years, or have completed several jobs at different levels of the training. During the preparation, they have distinguished themselves by their cooperation and commitment to provide the highest quality of content and form. The feedback they received from the participants as well as from the institution was overall very positive.
b25d9e11-c9ba-4d58-b497-db4f0321c9cd.name: Professional Coach and Teacher

badge_template_activities.title: To be accepted, the trainer must have completed basic professional military education (military academy), have led a battalion and meet high standards in the field of methodology and teaching. In addition, the coach must have an interest or knowledge in the field of economics.
Battalion Commander at Swiss Armed Forces
At least two years managerial experience.
Successful conduct of own classes all over TRANSFER modules.
Organisation of various mass-tailored exercises / successful Organisation of training and preparation days.
Strong methodical and coaching qualities.

7174d567-2c06-4bd9-9673-49768f0dc077.description: These badge earners have successfully worked for at least for three years as a trainer at MIKA Command in transfer management courses. In this time the earners demonstrated high methodological, didactic and leadership skills and were able to interact in the civil economic and military world.
7174d567-2c06-4bd9-9673-49768f0dc077.name: Coach Problem Solving

badge_template_activities.title: In order to participate, trainers have completed the military education and successfully passed qualitative assessment. The coach candidate must have successfully completed a career as an officer and hold a leadership position in the private sector.
(professional and militia officers) as a coach and teacher military and civil problem solving.
At least three years of managerial experience.
Successful conduct of own classes all over TRANSFER modules.
Organisation of various mass-tailored exercises / successful organization of training and preparation days.
Strong methodical and coaching qualities.

7ef310c9-f0b8-4672-ac33-38d0e1b68f07.description: The earners have distinguished themselves for a minimum of two years in the preparation of teaching staff and in the conception of modern and current scenarios, as well as in the management of customers and company managers in the field of training.
7ef310c9-f0b8-4672-ac33-38d0e1b68f07.name: Train the trainer

badge_template_activities.title: In his professional career, he must have led a battalion and been deployed in large staffs at brigade and/or division level. In addition to high teaching and methodical standards, he must have an affinity with the business world. He must have proven his ability to interact with leaders of all levels. In the preparation of personnel, he/she must know how to anticipate problems, propose innovations and enable them to successfully fulfil their missions and/or tasks.
Battalion Commander at Swiss Armed Forces
At least twa years of activity as a manager.
Successful conduct of own classes all over TRANSFER modules.
